It is a small, terrestrial plant typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its creeping stems and clusters of small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces sporangia on specialized structures called synangia, which are clustered in groups known as strobila. Gleichenia matthewii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
